F:DROP_90 | DROP_GOOD | DROP_GREAT | SMART | CAN_SPEAK | INVISIBLE | 
F:OPEN_DOOR | BASH_DOOR | TAKE_ITEM | EVIL | CAN_SWIM | DUNGEON | 
F:WILD_TOWN | WILD_WASTE | WILD_WOOD | WILD_GRASS | DROP_CORPSE | 
F:DROP_SKELETON
D:"Down the face of a precipice, sheer and almost smooth it seemed
D: in the pale moonlight, a small black shape was moving with its
D: thin limbs splayed out. Maybe its soft clinging hands and toes
D: were used, but it looked as if it was just creeping down on
D: sticky pads, like some large prowling thing of insect-kind.
D:  And it was coming down head first, as if it was smelling its
D: way.  Now and again it lifted its head slowly, turning it right
D: back on its long skinny neck, and the hobbits caught a glimpse
D: of two small pale gleaming lights, its eyes that blinked at
D: the moon for a moment and then were quickly lidded again."

D: typical of a diminutive monkey than a of a rat; while the small
D: skull with its savage yellow fangs is of the utmost anomalousness,
D: appearing from certain angles like a miniature, monstrously
D: degrade parody of a human skull."

D: looked like something that had started out to be a man but had
D: never quite made it. It had been stepped on, twisted, had holes
D: poked into the sickly dough of its head-bulge. Bones showed
D: through the transparent flesh of its torso and its short legs
D: were as thick as trees, terminating in disk-shaped pads from
D: which dozens of long toes hung like roots or worms. its arms
D: were longer than its entire body. it was a crushed slug, a thing
D: that had been frozen and thawed before it was fully baked. It
D: was - 'It is the Borshin', said the Lord of Bats."

D: thing, all had uniformly bloodshot eyes. Very, very bloodshot

D: all had an extra joint to each finger and thumb, and sharp,
D: forward-curving spurs on the backs of their hands. All of them
D: had prominent jaws (and) forty-four teeth, most of them longer
D: than human teeth, and several looking to be much sharper. Their
D: flesh was grayish and hard and shiny. There were undoubtedly
D: other differences also, but those were sufficient to prove a
D: point of some sort."

N:587:Shan

F:NO_CONF | NO_SLEEP | CAN_FLY | DUNGEON
S:1_IN_2 | 
S:SHRIEK | DRAIN_MANA | MIND_BLAST | CONF | HOLD | FORGET
D:"Those huge lidless eyes which stared with hate at me, the jointed
D: tendrils which seemed to twist from the head in cosmic rhythms,
D: the ten legs, covered with black shining tentacles and folded
D: into the pallid underbelly, and the semi-circular ridged wings
D: covered with triangular scales -- all this cannot convey the
D: soul-ripping horror of the shape which darted at me. I saw the
D: three mouths of the thing move moistly, and then it was upon
D: me."

D: because they had no faces at all to smile with, but only to

D: and her hair was green, though streaked with silver, and her
D: eyes were round of moons of jade and her brows rose like the
D: wings of olive gulls. Her mouth was small, her chin was small;
D: her cheeks were high and wide and rounded. A circlet of white
D: gold crossed her brow and there was a crystal necklace about
D: her neck. At its tip there flashed a sapphire between her sweet
D: bare breasts, whose nipples were also bare green. She wore scaled
D: trunks of blue and a silver belt, and she held a scepter of
D: pink coral in her hand and had a ring upon every finger, and
D: each ring had a stone of a different blue within it. She did
D: not smile..."

D: was around five feet tall and a hunchback. His hair and beard
D: were as heavy as (Corwin's). The only distinguishing features
D: in that great mass of fur were his long, hook nose and his almost
D: black eyes, now squinted against the light... Dworkin: 'I am
D: Oberon's prisoner.' Corwin: 'Oh? None of us knew that Dad had
D: locked you up.' (Corwin) heard (Dworkin) weeping. 'Yes,' he
D: said after a long time. 'He didn't trust me.' 'Why not?' 'I
D: told him I'd thought of a way to destroy Amber. I described
D: it to him, and he locked me in.'"

D: the sky split; deep clefts opened through which the darkness
D: began to ooze, a darkness blacker than the night, which crawled
D: down as a set of slimy tentacles, taking on more form, more
D: definite shape... something was standing, outlined against the
D: black sky, something which had tentacles of darkness and a green-glowing

D: all that is light and good in the world.  He is the origin of
D: man's fear of darkness and created many foul creatures with
D: his evil powers.  Orcs, Dragons, and Trolls are his most foul
D: corruptions, causing much pain and suffering in the world to
D: please him.  His disgusting visage, twisted with evil, is crowned
D: with iron, the two remaining Silmarils forever burning him.
D:  Grond, the mighty Hammer of the Underworld, cries defiance
D: as he strides towards you to crush you to a pulp!
